result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheree Marie Schultz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sheree Marie Schultz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler James Rubenzer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Plaisted appeared as a friend of the Court for defendant Sheree Marie Schultz.
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense counsel has not received discovery and offer and requests additional time. Court grants request.
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sheree Marie Schultz in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael B. Plaisted appeared as a friend of the Court.
Case in court for a Pretrial Conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter (22CT127) before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-02-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GO.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Sheree Marie Schultz in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Sheree Marie Schultz.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/31/22 @ 2p
